intro: Andromeda ledifolia, commonly known as the sweet azalea, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy clusters of bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full shade. Its leaves are elliptical, glossy, and dark green, while its flowers range in color from white to pink and bloom in early spring. Andromeda ledifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to naturalize in suitable environments.
